item.title: Nick Knowles becomes sixth contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity - Independent.ie
item.description:
Nick Knowles becomes sixth contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity  Independent.ie

Nick Knowles has become the sixth contestant to face the boot from I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! following a public vote. After his name was called by hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby, the television presenter turned to Fleur East, who had also been at risk of leaving, to say: “I’m glad you’re still in, darling.” DIY SOS host Knowles managed 20 days in the jungle and became the camp’s de facto cook, playing a fatherly figure to the group’s younger members. After hugging his campmates, Knowles joined Willoughby and Donnelly in the studio where he said he hoped the camp’s ca...

item.title: Anne Hegerty let slip a massive spoiler on I'm A Celeb last night - Her.ie
item.description:
Anne Hegerty let slip a massive spoiler on I'm A Celeb last night  Her.ie

Shocking behaviour. Anne Hegerty has gone and ruined the entire I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here illusion by saying that she has to go over and do a few bits for Xtra Camp before the trial. The Governess let slip that the group trial scenario wouldn't be taking place until a bit later on because she had to go "do something for ITV2" beforehand. This was before Xtra Camp had gotten the chance to announce that Anne was even going to be on the show so, you know, probably one of the reasons why live feeds on reality programmes aren't exactly a thing anymore. Shattering the illusion, great to...

item.title: 7 hilarious moments from last night's I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here - Her.ie
item.description:
7 hilarious moments from last night's I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here  Her.ie

Day 11 Boy oh boy thatI'm A Celebjungle, am I right? Last night's show saw Malique and Sair take on the dreaded eating edition of the Bushtucker trial, giving them both the chance to prove that they're slightly more interesting than we've seen up to now. Spoiler: They didn't. Dec made a tit of himself in front of a plate of literal cow tits, Harry dropped the joke of the series and Nick Knowles revealed his crippling fear of women's knickers. This is it, we are living in the golden age of television. Truly, what a time it is to be alive. Here's seven hilarious moments from last night's show...

item.title: I’m a Celebrity's Nick Knowles accused of ‘unconscious homophobia’ after knicker row with John Barrowman - The Independent
item.description:
I’m a Celebrity's Nick Knowles accused of ‘unconscious homophobia’ after knicker row with John Barrowman  The Independent

Nick Knowles has been accused of being “unconsciously homophobic” to John Barrowman in last night's episode of I'm a Celebrity. The British TV presenter, best known for DIY SOS, angered some fans after stating he felt uncomfortable touching underwear belonging to his female campmates but asked Barrowman to move them instead. “I don’t feel comfortable handling women’s knickers but they are wet and need drying so would you hang them on the line?” Knowles asked the Torchwood entertainer. Barrowman, who is openly gay, responded: “Then why is it okay for me, a gay man, to pick it up but it’s not...

item.title: Noel Edmonds’ wife ‘pleased’ to see him shirtless in I’m A Celeb jungle - Independent.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds’ wife ‘pleased’ to see him shirtless in I’m A Celeb jungle  Independent.ie

Noel Edmonds’ wife has said she is proud of him for showing off his body in the I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! jungle. The TV presenter, 69, has been praised by surprised viewers for his youthful, muscular physique while taking part in the reality series, with some even dubbing him an unlikely sex symbol. Liz Davies told ITV’s This Morning: “He does numerous things (to keep fit) and I am very proud of him, he does look good. I am very pleased to see him without his top on.” Noel Edmonds (ITV/REX/Shutterstock) Asked how he stays fit, she replied: “He’s just very careful about what he e...

item.title: Anne Hegerty wants to stay in I’m A Celebrity jungle until voted out - Independent.ie
item.description:
Anne Hegerty wants to stay in I’m A Celebrity jungle until voted out  Independent.ie

Anne Hegerty has revealed she wants to remain in the jungle until she gets voted off after an emotional start to I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here!. The Chase quizmaster broke down in tears on her first night in the I’m A Celebrity camp, and immediately thought about quitting the show and returning home. Hegerty confided in campmate Nick Knowles, saying she lay awake thinking of all the people she would disappoint by exiting the competition early. The quiz show star said she has now changed her mind and does not want to leave camp until she is voted off. She said: “I spent the first three...

item.title: Anne Hegerty has not got I’m A Celebrity game plan – Chase co-star - Independent.ie
item.description:
Anne Hegerty has not got I’m A Celebrity game plan – Chase co-star  Independent.ie

Anne Hegerty has been defended by her co-star on The Chase Mark Labbett, who said the I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! campmate has not got a “game plan”. Quiz maestro Hegerty, who has Asperger’s, has faced criticism from some I’m A Celebrity fans due to her being ruled out of a number of challenges on medical grounds. Some viewers have also said they think Hegerty is receiving preferential treatment and suggested that she was given a soft drink to consume instead of fish eye juice in a Bushtucker trial earlier this week. The governess has only gone and added 'record breaker' to her lis...

item.title: I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp - The Independent
item.description:
I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp  The Independent

I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here is back, with a new raft of famous faces entering the jungle. Football manager Harry Redknapp, Torchwood star John Barrowman and X Factor favourite Fleur East lead this year’s contestants, with Noel Edmonds joining the intrepid adventurers (for a reported £500,000 payday) as the series' final contestant. James McVey, who found fame as part of boy band The Vamps, also appears on the show, alongside soap stars Sair Khan (Coronation Street), Rita Simons (EastEnders) and Malique Thompson-Dwyer (Hollyoaks). Who else features? You can see all eleven of this y...

item.title: Drinking blended turkey testicles - I'm a Celebrity whips out the big Bushtucker guns early - Independent.ie
item.description:
Drinking blended turkey testicles - I'm a Celebrity whips out the big Bushtucker guns early  Independent.ie

The I’m A Celebrity campers had to eat witchetty grubs, drink blended turkey testicles and sing while covered in ants as part of a terrifying live X Factor themed trial. The contestants were taken to a “studio” made to look like the set of the singing contest and told they would take on a series of challenges based on the ITV show. Rounds include The Sting Off, The Sick Chair Challenge, Judges critter-cism and Dread-lock. In The Sting-Off, Malique Thompson-Dwyer and Emily Atack had to try and sing popular songs while wearing mouth guards – as creepy crawlies roamed all over them. The other ...

item.title: Is it the Holly effect? I’m A Celebrity launch episode breaks ratings record - Independent.ie
item.description:
Is it the Holly effect? I’m A Celebrity launch episode breaks ratings record  Independent.ie

The first episode of the new series of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! – starring new presenter Holly Willoughby – has become the most-watched launch episode in the show’s history. ITV said the episode has been watched by 13.7 million viewers over the past seven days, according to consolidated data. The overall number has grown from the original overnight ratings, which showed that 11 million people tuned in for the first episode. I'm A Celebrity scores highest launch audience ever, consolidated data reveals. 13.7 million viewers. @imacelebrity Read more... https://t.co/fRIORmOA3b pic....

item.title: Anne Hegerty compares emperor Noel Edmonds’ palace to that of Saddam Hussein - Independent.ie
item.description:
Anne Hegerty compares emperor Noel Edmonds’ palace to that of Saddam Hussein  Independent.ie

Anne Hegerty has likened emperor Noel Edmonds’ palace on I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! to something the late Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein might have built. Viewers of the ITV reality programme were left baffled and amused in equal measure after the professional quizzer, 60, made the comment on Thursday’s show. Following Edmonds dramatic entrance, the group returned to their campsite to find a makeshift palace consisting of a bed, lectern and gold throne, which had been built while they were away. While some of the 10 contestants were envious of Edmonds’ palatial quarters, Hegerty, ...

item.title: I'm a Celeb viewers complain about severe lack of James McVey airtime - Her.ie
item.description:
I'm a Celeb viewers complain about severe lack of James McVey airtime  Her.ie

James, who? Just kidding. Everybody knows that James McVey is the lead guitarist of British pop band, The Vamps. But does everybody know that he's also appearing in this year's series of I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here!because honestly, nah, we didn't. The jungle has a lot of large-ish characters wandering around it this year. Everyone from Anne Hegerty to Noel Edmonds to Fleur from that one season of X Factor have been living it up in the Aussie jungle for the past week or so. With them has been James McVey but, for some reason, the musician hasn't been featured half as much as his arg...

item.title: Noel Edmonds has finally appeared in I'm A Celebrity and is already dividing opinion - JOE.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds has finally appeared in I'm A Celebrity and is already dividing opinion  JOE.ie

All was right in the jungle, until a certain Mr Edmonds showed up... This year's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here has been really enjoyable so far. Harry Redknapp and his many stories have gone down a hit, Anne Hegarty has been a delight, and the challenges have all been exciting. And on top of all of that, the overall vibe among the camp has been a positive one. No egos, no divas, just all of them getting on with it. It has been refreshing. But now, it looks like things are all about to change, because Noel Edmonds has arrived. And with him has come the title of 'The Emperor'. We have...

item.title: Anne Hegerty's got a 'secret' husband and Twitter's on a mission to find him - Her.ie
item.description:
Anne Hegerty's got a 'secret' husband and Twitter's on a mission to find him  Her.ie

He's not a secret though, lads. He just doesn't exist. If you're at all familiar with the life and times of Anne Hegerty, you'll be aware of a few things. One of those things is that she plays the role of the Governess on ITV's The Chase.Another one of those things is that she was diagnosed with Asperger's back in 2005 and that through I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here she's been inspiring a lot of people. And another one of those things is that her Wikipedia page used to say she was married to some lad called Jake Hester. Anne dropped the bombshell during last night's instalment of the s...

item.title: I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! review: Holly Willoughby has difficult debut while Harry Redknapp misses his bacon sandwiches - The Telegraph
item.description:
I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! review: Holly Willoughby has difficult debut while Harry Redknapp misses his bacon sandwiches  The Telegraph

There were plenty of bugs in the jungle but no Ant as I’m A Celebrity… crashed through the canopy for its latest season. The other conspicuous absence was TV gnome Noel Edmonds, widely touted as a contestant this year but not featured in the first episode. Very much in situ, though, was the absent Anthony McPartlin’s temporary replacement, Holly Willoughby. The This Morning presenter seemed subdued as the curtain rose. First night jitters also emanated from Declan Donnelly, visibly trying too hard to create a spark with his new foil. Meanwhile, we’re still at the getting-to-know-you stage w...

item.title: There was a HUGE outpouring of support for this I'm A Celeb contestant last night - Her.ie
item.description:
There was a HUGE outpouring of support for this I'm A Celeb contestant last night  Her.ie

It all got too much for one contestant. This years lineup of celebrities made their journey into the jungle last night and after some tough challenges, one campmate became overwhelmed when they finally made it to camp. Going head-to-head to determine which camp the teams would go to for their first few nights in the jungle, the red team came out on top, heading to the more luxurious Croc Creek. However, that left the yellow team making their way to Snake Rock, a much more basic camp that left the members of the team in total shock. Anne Hegerty broke down when her team made it to their home...

item.title: Emily Atack braves a record-breaking 50 snakes in I’m A Celebrity trial - Independent.ie
item.description:
Emily Atack braves a record-breaking 50 snakes in I’m A Celebrity trial  Independent.ie

Emily Atack broke an I’m A Celebrity record by taking on more than 50 snakes in a Bushtucker Trial. The Inbetweeners star was the first of this year’s campers to tackle one of the gruelling trials. In Monday night’s instalment of the ITV show, she had to brave a Viper Pit filled with a variety of pythons and rummage for stars – which represented food for the hungry campers. Atack was shaking as she moved through different chambers in the pit, as hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby looked on in horror. There was a terrifying moment when one of the snakes lunged for her hand as she tri...

item.title: I’m A Celebrity returns with Holly Willoughby and record viewing figures - Independent.ie
item.description:
I’m A Celebrity returns with Holly Willoughby and record viewing figures  Independent.ie

Holly Willoughby has proven to be a lucky charm for I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! with the show enjoying its most-watched launch since 2013. Some 11 million people tuned in for the first episode – up 700,000 on last year, according to overnight ratings. Looks like @Redknapp DEFINITELY wasn't lying when he said he'd never seen #ImACeleb before 😱@ImACelebrity pic.twitter.com/IBUVZ7qm6d — ITV (@ITV) November 18, 2018 It was the biggest overnight audience for any channel so far this year, excluding the World Cup, according to ITV. It was also the fourth-largest audience for the launch ...

item.title: Autistic boy writes letter to Anne Hegerty calling her an inspiration - The Independent
item.description:
Autistic boy writes letter to Anne Hegerty calling her an inspiration  The Independent

A schoolboy's heartfelt letter to I'm A Celebrity contestant Anne Hegerty about their shared experience of autism has received thousands of shares online. Joseph Hughes, 11, from Preston, was diagnosed with autism at the age of five. According to his mother, Kate Jarvis, 31, he "has quite a few struggles, especially socially, but he's a lovely little boy". Ms Jarvis said Joseph was "amazed" at seeing Hegerty, who has Asperger's syndrome, as The Governess on ITV gameshow The Chase. "He sees his autism quite negatively sometimes, so was pleased to see someone with autism doing something like ...

A schoolboy’s heartfelt letter to I’m A Celebrity contestant Anne Hegerty about their shared experience of autism has received thousands of shares online. Joseph Hughes, 11, from Preston, was diagnosed with autism at the age of five. Ms Jarvis said Joseph was “amazed” at seeing Hegerty, who has Asperger’s syndrome, as The Governess on ITV gameshow The Chase. “He sees his autism quite negatively sometimes, so was pleased to see someone with autism doing something like ...

item.title: Harry Redknapp sets out tactics in crab-stroking I’m A Celebrity debut - The Guardian
item.description:
Harry Redknapp sets out tactics in crab-stroking I’m A Celebrity debut  The Guardian

“They’ve got a football manager on the other team. That’s a bit of a problem because he’s probably good at tactics,” said Rita Simons (once of EastEnders), peering suspiciously at Harry Redknapp before the first full-team challenge on I’m a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, which involved extended paddling in a boat incapable of holding everyone who wanted to paddle in it. Related: David Squires on … Mourinho, Ederson and all the Manchester derby fallout “Yeah, but does he know tactics for rowing across a lake?” wondered Anne Hegerty (of quiz show The Chase). And this is the key question: how ...

item.title: The Chase’s Anne Hegerty opted for Governess alias because it was ‘more kinky’ - Independent.ie
item.description:
The Chase’s Anne Hegerty opted for Governess alias because it was ‘more kinky’  Independent.ie

The Chase’s Anne Hegerty has admitted that she chose her foreboding alias The Governess because it sounded “more kinky” than The Headmistress. The intimidating quiz show regular became attached to the nickname after the ITV programme’s host Bradley Walsh suggested it. But while her look may remind some viewers of the nightmarish Roald Dahl school principal Miss Trunchbull, she said it’s the governors who really hold the power. The Chase’s Anne Hegerty opted for Governess alias because it was ‘more kinky’ twitter 1 Speaking to ITV’s Loose Women following a makeover on Thursday, she said: “Or...

item.title: 11-year-old boy writes Anne Hegerty touching letter about autism - Her.ie
item.description:
11-year-old boy writes Anne Hegerty touching letter about autism  Her.ie

An 11-year-old boy has written Anne Hegerty a touching letter about autism. Since The Chase star entered the I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here jungle last week, she has been highly praised for her honest discussion of living with Asperger's Syndrome. Hegerty said that she doesn't usually bring up her diagnosis herself, but that if somebody else does, she's "happy to talk about it." Speaking in the bush telegraph, she said: "I really appreciate how nice and sympathetic they've been to me. "It was nice that they said I pick up on social cues because I'm never quite sure that I entirely do. ...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity presenter Joel Dommett rushed to hospital after on-set accident - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity presenter Joel Dommett rushed to hospital after on-set accident  The Independent

The presenter of I’m a Celebrity‘s companion show Extra Camp, Joel Dommett, has been rushed to hospital after suffering an injury on set. Dommett was missing from last night’s episode (20 November) after windy conditions reportedly blew a wooden sign onto his head. The 32-year-old comedian required seven stitches. His co-presenters Scarlett Moffatt and Joe Swash presented without him, the former telling viewers: “Unfortunately we’re a man down as Joel isn’t well, but the show must go on.” Dommett posted a photograph of his bandaged head to Instagram, writing: “I had seven stitches like a bi...

item.title: Stop it! Anne Hegerty had everyone in bits on tonight's I'm a Celebrity - Her.ie
item.description:
Stop it! Anne Hegerty had everyone in bits on tonight's I'm a Celebrity  Her.ie

Anne Hegerty had everyone in bits on tonight's I'm a Celebrity. Right from the start, there's always one contestant who everyone loves and this year, it's Anne Hegerty whom many will recognise as the Governess on The Chase. Last night, Anne said she was feeling the pressure and that she didn't know if she could manage to keep going with the show but her fellow campmatesrallied around her and showed support. So far, so good and Anne returned the favour when Emily was picked for the Bushtucker trial on this evening's show. A few of the ladies sat around and mediated with Fleur East saying a p...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Noel Edmonds officially unveiled as final contestant to enter jungle - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: Noel Edmonds officially unveiled as final contestant to enter jungle  The Independent

After a week of rumours, ITV has officially announced that Noel Edmonds is heading into the I'm A Celebrity jungle. The former host of Deal Or No Deal will join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, The Chase star Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. "Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!" read a Tweet from the I'm A Celebrity Twitter account on Tuesday (20 November). Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle! #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/dGjIsTegT9 — I'm A Celebrity... (@imacelebrity) 21 November 2018 The pos...

item.title: Everyone is saying the same thing about Anne after tonight's I'm A Celebrity - Her.ie
item.description:
Everyone is saying the same thing about Anne after tonight's I'm A Celebrity  Her.ie

It is only a few days into the new series of I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!,but there's already been plenty of action. Tonight's episode was no exception as the second Bushtucker Trial took place - and it was particularly gruesome. The end of Monday night's episode revealed that Anne Hegarty was the one who had been selected to take on the challenge: theMonstrous Monoliths. The Chasestar was locked in a series of giant stones,with the aim being to release the two stars in the two Perspex boxes in each stone. There were four digit codes on the walls of the stones, which corresponded t...

item.title: Noel Edmonds confirmed for the I'm a Celebrity jungle - Independent.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds confirmed for the I'm a Celebrity jungle  Independent.ie

Noel Edmonds has officially been announced as an I’m A Celebrity contestant. The 69-year-old former host of Deal Or No Deal and Noel’s House Party will enter the Australian jungle to join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, quiz expert Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. Edmonds’s arrival had been rumoured and was confirmed by the official I’m A Celebrity Twitter account on Tuesday. Noel Edmonds has officially been unveiled as an I’m A Celebrity contestant (Jonathan Brady/PA) The tweet said: “Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!” The po...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity 2018 – LIVE: Emily Atack to tackle first Bushtucker trial as Harry Redknapp and Nick Knowles enter camp - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity 2018 – LIVE: Emily Atack to tackle first Bushtucker trial as Harry Redknapp and Nick Knowles enter camp  The Independent

I’m a Celebrity returns to ITV tonight with a whole new bunch of celebrities to chomp on witchetty grubs. This year’s camp mates include former football manager Harry Redknapp, The Chase star Anne Hegarty and John Barrowman (Torchwood). DIY SOS’s Nick Knowles, soap star Sair Khan (Coronation Street) and James McVey from boy band The Vamps will also appear. Recent reports have also claimed that British presenter Noel Edmonds will enter the Australian jungle as this year’s secret camp mate. Bosses are said to have offered him £500,000 to take part - the most money the ITV show has ever paid f...

item.title: Fans and friends rally round Anne Hegerty as she makes I’m A Celebrity debut - Independent.ie
item.description:
Fans and friends rally round Anne Hegerty as she makes I’m A Celebrity debut  Independent.ie

Fans, fellow Chasers and Rylan Clark-Neal have heaped praise on Anne Hegerty as the quiz maestro made her I’m A Celebrity debut. Hegerty, who stars as the stern Governess in ITV’s teatime quiz show The Chase, has Asperger’s and had told how elements of being in the camp could be a “source of stress”. The 60-year-old became upset during Sunday’s opening episode, telling her fellow celebrity contestants: “I’m just really, really close to saying I can’t do this.” Rugby referee Alex Lambe hailed Hegerty as an “incredible person” who had given him confidence to speak about his experience living ...

item.title: Rita Simons reveals obsessive compulsive disorder diagnosis - Independent.ie
item.description:
Rita Simons reveals obsessive compulsive disorder diagnosis  Independent.ie

Rita Simons opens up about her obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) diagnosis as she gets to know her campmates on I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! The former EastEnders star confides in The Chase’s Anne Hegerty in scenes due to air in Monday night’s instalment of the ITV show. She revealed her own struggle after a discussion about Hegerty having Asperger syndrome. “You know that I’m fully diagnosed OCD… I’m much better now,” Simons says. Anne Hegerty (Ian West/PA) Singer Fleur East asks Simons how she can cope with jungle life, and the actress replies: “I’m not too bad with cleanliness ...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here 2018, review: Dec and Holly lack chemistry in uncompelling launch - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here 2018, review: Dec and Holly lack chemistry in uncompelling launch  The Independent

According to the pre-publicity for I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! 2018, Anne Hegerty (The Governess from The Chase) was worried that her autism and being “faceblind” would make things tricky for her in the jungle. For some of us viewers too. To be more honest than I ought to be, I’ve never been quite sure who Holly Willoughby is and, thanks to the recent troubled story of Ant McPartlin, I now know, by elimination, who Dec is. Anyhow, Dec and Holly lack a certain chemistry, like a couple who’ve finally decided to get married, but realise a few months in that they might have made a te...

item.title: The new Doctor Who companion is... not who we were expecting - Her.ie
item.description:
The new Doctor Who companion is... not who we were expecting  Her.ie

Last month, it was revealed that Jodie Whittaker was to become the first female Doctor Who. Fans of the show and general supporters of more female representation in TV shows were only delighted by the casting - as were we. But with the news that Whittaker was taking over the role of everyone's favourite Time Lord came questions about who was going to be her companion. Traditionally, the Doctor's companion travels through space and time with the Doctor, sharing all their adventures, and occasionally helping them out of tricky situations. Was this companion going to be male? Were they going t...

item.title: Everything you need to know about this year's season of I'm A Celeb - JOE.ie
item.description:
Everything you need to know about this year's season of I'm A Celeb  JOE.ie

Will you be watching I'm A Celeb this year? Christmas time is quickly approaching. Before you know it, we're all going to be rushing around the shops getting presents for friends and family at the very last seconds. But before we get to that, we have to get through I'm A Celeb season first. We have no doubt that you're going to be tuning in, but you might have a few questions before everything gets started. So here is absolutely everything you need to know. When is it on? The first episode of the show kicks off at 9pm on Sunday night. Where can I watch it? Every episode of I'm A Celeb will ...

Noel Edmonds has officially been announced as an I'm A Celebrity contestant. The 69-year-old former host of Deal Or No Deal and Noel's House Party will enter the Australian jungle to join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, quiz expert Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!" The post, which described Edmonds as a "TV legend", listed his phobias as heights and confined spaces...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Anne Hegerty praised by autism charity for talking about her diagnosis on ITV show - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: Anne Hegerty praised by autism charity for talking about her diagnosis on ITV show  The Independent

Anne Hegerty has been praised by an autism charity for appearing on I’m A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! Best known for appearing as “The Governess” on The Chase, Hegerty has spoken candidly about her experience with Asperger’s syndrome – a condition that can affect a person’s social interactions, communication, interests and behaviour – on the the ITV series. “We’ve loved seeing the outpouring of support for Anne Hegerty. We hope this will be the start of better representation of autistic women in the media and help everyone understand the diversity of autism,” a statement from the Natio...

item.title: Noel Edmonds officially joins I'm a Celebrity - JOE.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds officially joins I'm a Celebrity  JOE.ie

Kiosk Kev vs the Banker. Deal Or No Deal host and Mr Blobby accomplice Noel Edmonds will join the rest of the I'm a Celeb hopefuls in the Australian jungle. Followingweeks of feverish speculation, Edmonds confirmed on Wednesday morning he will appear on the reality TV show. "After everything I have done with Gotchas and gunging, I am well aware they are going to put me through absolute hell and I deserve it," Edmonds said. "I think the British public will enjoy seeing me finally getting my comeuppance. I just know they are going to really give me a hard time." The boy Noel Credit: ITV So, w...

item.title: A few extra names have JUST been added to the official I'm A Celeb lineup - Her.ie
item.description:
A few extra names have JUST been added to the official I'm A Celeb lineup  Her.ie

Six more sleeps. I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here returns to our screens this Sunday night and it's fair to see we're buzzing. After bringing you several of the stars rumoured to be taking part in the show, we can now reveal that all the names we predicted have been confirmed - plus four more. We pretty much already knew that TV presenter Nick Knowles, actor Emily Atack, singer Fleur East, Vamps bassist James McVey, Hollyoaks starMalique Thompson-Dwyerand ex-EastEnders cast member Rita Simons would be appearing this year. Virgin Media One has just revealed that they'll be joined by four m...
